Detailed Description

Implementation of config routines for the LLP module.

Function Documentation

int check_sanity (  )  [static]

Checks the sanity of the parameters used in the configuration.

Return values:
CONFIG_SANE - if the configurations parameters make sense,
CONFIG_NOT_SANE - otherwise.

int copy_function_string ( char *  dst,
int  max,
char *  src 
) [static]

Copies max chars from src to dst. If string capacity is not enough, function_string is copied until the last function name occurrence.

Parameters:
[out] dst - buffer to receive the function string.
[in] max - the buffer capacity.
[in] src - source string.
Return values:
LLP_ERROR - if function_string was truncated.
Returns:
the number of bytes copied.

char * get_function_string ( llp_function_list_t *  list  )  [static]

Returns a string that specifies supported cryptographic functions. The string is allocated to store all the function name and the format of this string is "function1;function2;".

Parameters:
[out] list - the list of functions supported.
Returns:
an allocated string representing the functions.

int llp_get_cipher_string ( char *  string,
int  max 
)

Fills a string containing all cipher functions supported. The string must be pre-allocated, and the parameter max controls the maximum number of bytes that can be written in string, including the terminating \0. If the string capacity is not enough to store the amount of data needed, an error is returned.

Parameters:
[out] string - array that will store the ciphers string
[in] max - maximum number of bytes that can be written in string
Return values:
LLP_ERROR - if the string capacity is not enough
Returns:
the number of bytes written in string.

Definition at line 626 of file llp_config.c.

Referenced by send_connection_request().

        {EXPIRATION_TIME_KEYWORD, ARG_INT, handle_int, NULL, CTX_ALL},
        {STATIC_NODES_FILE_KEYWORD, ARG_STR, handle_file, NULL, CTX_ALL},
        {RECENT_NODES_FILE_KEYWORD, ARG_STR, handle_file, NULL, CTX_ALL},
        {CIPHER_LIST_KEYWORD, ARG_LIST, handle_ciphers, NULL, CTX_ALL},
        {HASH_LIST_KEYWORD, ARG_LIST, handle_hashes, NULL, CTX_ALL},
        {MAC_LIST_KEYWORD, ARG_LIST, handle_macs, NULL, CTX_ALL},
        LAST_OPTION
}
Data structure that defines the configuration options used by the parser.
